page.title: 16Technology in Bourtie
page.content: One of the side-effects of being a country area within 20 miles of Aberdeen has been the injection of technology associated with North Sea Oil. Bourtie is essentially greenbelt, with strict regulations governing housing or other deelopment, unless it replaces an existing derelict building. Within the last few years there have been a number of requests to Gordon district Planning Department of housing in Bourtie and only three hae been granted. One included building a helipad outside a private dwelling at Woodside of Thornton, Pitgaveny. Local resients objected when permission was granted to a pilot, employed to Dyce airport for thi construction. Two years later, the man, with mobility associated with his job, sold his house and the permission was rescinded
